Job Title: Associate, Integrated Media Planning

Location: New York, NY

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Marketing, Sales

Description:
Overview

MOST CREATIVE MEDIA AGENCY NETWORK | 11 TIMES IN A ROW BY THE GUNN REPORT

ADWEEK’S GLOBAL MEDIA AGENCY OF THE YEAR 2019 & 2020

OMD USA is a proud part of the global OMD network. In the US, we have 2,250+ people across 9 offices, dedicated to delivering insights that unlock demand potential, ideas that ignite consumer desire and results that accelerate business growth for our clients. We are a dynamic, creative and influential agency network that collectively combines to make OMD the most awarded agency network in the world.

The Associate, Integrated Media Planning assists in the coordination and execution of media plans under the guidance of a Senior Associate. As the day-to-day support to the account team, some responsibilities involve: gathering data to support a media recommendation, updating client media activity flowcharts, assisting the team in responding to a client need, preparing purchase authorizations by coordinating input from internal teams, and/or assisting with tracking media expenditures to ensure budget compliance. At an entry-level, the Associate will begin to develop a working knowledge of the media space (including digital media) and available media research.

Qualifications

Graduate of a four-year college or university0-1 year of business experience or industry internshipsIntermediate proficiency with Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, PowerPoint and WordAn eagerness and passion to learn about media planning across channels and platformsStrong organization skills and high attention to detail

Responsibilities

Passion - approaches any situation with energy and interest. Displays passion for pop culture, trends and motivations in consumer behavior.Problem Solving - clients, partners and even we are imperfect, but all challenges have solutions. Supports management to address challenges and/or asks for help from above when needed.Accountability - stays on top of deliverables and ensures timely delivery of direct responsibilities.Inquisitive Spirit - possesses a desire to learn and acquire knowledge and understanding through day-to-day work experiences.Relationship Building - practices the ability to be personal, understanding and a desire to do what’s best for the team and the client.

OMD is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Compensation Range: $34,000 - $60,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health/vision/dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependence Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation, sick, personal days, paid parental leave, and paid medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
